headers.subject: [tosdr:2305] Yahoo! isn't liable for deleting or failing to store Content

html:
You agree that Yahoo! has no responsibility or liability for the deletion or failure to store any messages and other communications or other Content maintained or transmitted by the Yahoo! Services. You acknowledge that Yahoo! reserves the right to log off accounts that are inactive for an extended period of time.

http://info.yahoo.com/legal/us/yahoo/utos/terms/

This seems vague to me. Does this mean they aren't liable if they delete or fail to store your stuff? Or are they saying that is the user's responsibility? If it's the first case, then that's obviously incredibly terrible. If it's the second, that seems more reasonable. For what it's worth, this is under the heading "General practices regarding use and storage".

--
tosdr.org | twitter.com/tosdr | github.com/tosdr

subject: Yahoo! isn't liable for deleting or failing to store Content
text:
>
> You agree that Yahoo! has no responsibility or liability for the deletion 
> or failure to store any messages and other communications or other Content 
> maintained or transmitted by the Yahoo! Services. You acknowledge that 
> Yahoo! reserves the right to log off accounts that are inactive for an 
> extended period of time.


http://info.yahoo.com/legal/us/yahoo/utos/terms/

This seems vague to me. Does this mean they aren't liable if they delete or 
fail to store your stuff? Or are they saying that is the user's 
responsibility? If it's the first case, then that's obviously incredibly 
terrible. If it's the second, that seems more reasonable. For what it's 
worth, this is under the heading "General practices regarding use and 
storage".

--
